summary: This document is an email chain from March 2021 among U.S. Attorney's Office staff regarding persistent calls from a woman identifying herself as a former victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence details attempts to coordinate a response from federal agents and provides background on previous, unsuccessful attempts to contact victims through an attorney named Brad Edwards.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: An attorney who previously claimed to represent at least nine Epstein victims but was unresponsive to prosecutors' requests. He represented the calling victim for the Victim Fund.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified by the caller as the perpetrator of whom she was a former victim.

connections.description: Edwards represented the victim for purposes of the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund, though he was not currently representing her at the time of the call.
Prosecutors from the U.S. Attorney's Office had been in contact with Edwards in 2020 regarding his Epstein victim clients.
The caller identified herself as a former victim of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Victim Call to Prosecutor
events.description: A woman identifying as a former Epstein victim called an Assistant U.S. Attorney's desk line, seeking follow-up and providing her contact information.

events.title: Follow-up Call from Victim
events.description: The same victim called again, looking for a follow-up from the authorities.

events.title: Persistent Victim Contact
events.description: The victim called yet again, prompting prosecutors to ping federal agents for a third time to make contact.

events.title: Previous Prosecutor Contact with Attorney
events.description: In 2020, the U.S. Attorney's Office was in touch with attorney Brad Edwards, who claimed to represent multiple Epstein victims unwilling to speak with prosecutors.

keyFacts: A persistent, unnamed victim of Jeffrey Epstein was repeatedly contacting the U.S. Attorney's Office in early 2021, seeking a response from investigators.
The victim had been represented by attorney Brad Edwards for the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund, but he was not her current attorney at the time.
Prosecutors had prior, unproductive contact with Brad Edwards in 2020, where he claimed to represent multiple Epstein victims who were unwilling to speak with authorities.
The victim had also been in contact with an NYPD detective but had not heard back, indicating potential coordination issues between local and federal investigations.
The email chain reveals ongoing efforts by victims to engage with the investigation and logistical challenges within the prosecution team in responding to them.
